bug.author: Magolor
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
using torch_geometric.datasets.SNAPDataset with dataset name "ego-twitter" and "ego-gplus" results in an error. <denchmark-h:h2>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
Steps to reproduce the behavior: <denchmark-code>import torch_geometric.datasets as DS
data = DS.SNAPDataset("data/",name="ego-gplus") </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
e.g.: the "ego-twitter" configuration would lead to: <denchmark-code>KeyError: 83943787 </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>Environment</denchmark-h>
OS: Linux Python version: 3.8.3 PyTorch version: 1.6.0 CUDA/cuDNN version: 10.1 GCC version: Any other relevant information:
<denchmark-h:h2>Additional context</denchmark-h>

comments.comment: Seems to be a bug. I will look into it.
Fixed in master, see <denchmark-link:https://github.com/rusty1s/pytorch_geometric/commit/c56a50eb2f17a41c4b52d837eb66a44d8efbfee5>c56a50e</denchmark-link> . Thanks for reporting!

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/rusty1s>@rusty1s</denchmark-link> Thank you for your fast reply. The 'ego-twitter' dataset can function now, while the 'ego-gplus' dataset is still facing another error causing by the : <denchmark-code>Traceback (most recent call last): File "utils.py", line 79, in <module> dataset = DS.SNAPDataset('data/EgoGplus/',name='ego-gplus') File ".../lib/python3.8/site-packages/torch_geometric/datasets/snap_dataset.py", line 169, in __init__ super(SNAPDataset, self).__init__(root, transform, pre_transform, File ".../lib/python3.8/site-packages/torch_geometric/data/in_memory_dataset.py", line 53, in __init__ super(InMemoryDataset, self).__init__(root, transform, pre_transform, File ".../lib/python3.8/site-packages/torch_geometric/data/dataset.py", line 92, in __init__ self._process() File ".../lib/python3.8/site-packages/torch_geometric/dat.a/dataset.py", line 165, in _process self.process() File ".../lib/python3.8/site-packages/torch_geometric/datasets/snap_dataset.py", line 211, in process data_list = read_ego(raw_files, self.name[4:]) File "..../lib/python3.8/site-packages/torch_geometric/datasets/snap_dataset.py", line 42, in read_ego x = pandas.read_csv(feat_file, sep=' ', header=None, dtype=np.int64) File ".../lib/python3.8/site-packages/pandas/io/parsers.py", line 686, in read_csv return _read(filepath_or_buffer, kwds) File ".../lib/python3.8/site-packages/pandas/io/parsers.py", line 458, in _read data = parser.read(nrows) File ".../lib/python3.8/site-packages/pandas/io/parsers.py", line 1186, in read ret = self._engine.read(nrows) File ".../lib/python3.8/site-packages/pandas/io/parsers.py", line 2145, in read data = self._reader.read(nrows) File "pandas/_libs/parsers.pyx", line 847, in pandas._libs.parsers.TextReader.read File "pandas/_libs/parsers.pyx", line 862, in pandas._libs.parsers.TextReader._read_low_memory File "pandas/_libs/parsers.pyx", line 941, in pandas._libs.parsers.TextReader._read_rows File "pandas/_libs/parsers.pyx", line 1073, in pandas._libs.parsers.TextReader._convert_column_data File "pandas/_libs/parsers.pyx", line 1104, in pandas._libs.parsers.TextReader._convert_tokens File "pandas/_libs/parsers.pyx", line 1200, in pandas._libs.parsers.TextReader._convert_with_dtype File "pandas/_libs/parsers.pyx", line 1753, in pandas._libs.parsers._try_uint64 OverflowError: Overflow
</denchmark-code>
Should be working now :) Sorry for the inconveniences!
